pullRequest.body:
Define the type `Copy` as the subtype of injective homomorphisms.

Also define

- the predicate that a simple graph contains another simple graph `IsContained` (equivalent to "is isomorphic to a subgraph of"),
- the predicate that a simple graph is free of another simple graph `Free` for convenience.

---
<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your
PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

For details on the "pull request lifecycle" in mathlib, please see:
https://leanprover-community.github.io/contribute/index.html

In particular, note that most reviewers will only notice your PR
if it passes the continuous integration checks.
Please ask for help on https://leanprover.zulipchat.com if needed.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

If you are moving or deleting declarations, please include these lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Moves:
- Vector.* -> List.Vector.*
- ...

Deletions:
- Nat.bit1_add_bit1
- ...

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]

-->

* The `relative` value is the weighted *sum* of the differences with weight given by the *inverse* of the current value of the statistic.
* The `absolute` value is the `relative` value divided by the total sum of the inverses of the current values (i.e. the weighted *average* of the differences).
</details>
@kbuzzard I've been waiting for others' input on the name `SubgraphIso`. Feel free to weigh in. üòÅ
I still think `IsContained` is a better name than `IsIsoSubgraph`. What do you think, @b-mehta ?

I think having this (type-valued) definition is valuable, but I find the name pretty confusing here. To me, this is the type of non-induced copies of A inside B, rather than isomorphisms between A and a subgraph of B. As such, I'd prefer `Copy` or something here. But I'd also like others' input on the name
As an extension, I'm also not convinced that `‚â≤g` is helpful notation here: it looks too much like a prop-valued thing rather than data...

> I think having this (type-valued) definition is valuable, but I find the name pretty confusing here. To me, this is the type of non-induced copies of A inside B, rather than isomorphisms between A and a subgraph of B. As such, I'd prefer `Copy` or something here. But I'd also like others' input on the name

There doesn't seem to be a consistent name for injective graph homomorphisms. I've seen "graph embedding", "graph monomorphism", and "subgraph isomorphism". The first is taken. The second is common to category theory. [The third is used by Wolfram.](https://www.wolframalpha.com/input?i=FindSubgraphIsomorphism) (The third is also used by GPT-4o mini when asked about the subgraph isomorphism decision problem, not that it should be any authority on the topic.)
Inspired by some code @YaelDillies shared with me, `LabelledCopy` might also be an option.

I picked `IsIsoSubgraph` first, as `A.IsIsoSubgraph B` reads like "A is isomorphic to a subgraph of B". I picked `SubgraphIso` second, as `IsIsoSubgraph (A) (B) := Nonempty (SubgraphIso A B)`  reads like "A is isomorphic to a subgraph of B" := "the type of subgraph isomorphisms from A to B is nonempty" and that is often how the decision problem is phrased.

> As an extension, I'm also not convinced that `‚â≤g` is helpful notation here: it looks too much like a prop-valued thing rather than data...

I'll drop this in the same commit as the rename.
I think `Copy` is a good name, yes. Mind renaming?

> I think `Copy` is a good name, yes. Mind renaming?

That's the others' input I've been waiting for. Thanks @YaelDillies. :grin:
I'll resolve this in the commit dropping `‚â≤g`.

```suggestion
/-- The relation `IsIsoSubgraph A B` says that a simple graph `B` contains a copy of a simple graph `A`. -/
```

```suggestion
abbrev Embedding.toCopy (f : A ‚Ü™g B) : Copy A B := f.toHom.toCopy f.injective
```

```suggestion
abbrev Iso.toCopy (f : A ‚âÉg B) : Copy A B := f.toEmbedding.toCopy
```

```suggestion
def toEmbedding (f : Copy A B) : Œ± ‚Ü™ Œ≤ := ‚ü®f, f.injective‚ü©
```

```suggestion
@[refl] def id (G : SimpleGraph V) : Copy G G := ‚ü®Hom.id, Function.injective_id‚ü©
```
maybe?

```suggestion
def ofLE (G‚ÇÅ G‚ÇÇ : SimpleGraph V) (h : G‚ÇÅ ‚â§ G‚ÇÇ) : Copy G‚ÇÅ G‚ÇÇ :=
```
to avoid the knowledge of which graphs we're talking about being hidden inside an elided proof term
Can you show `ofLE` is functorial?
Could you adopt [my `IsContained` API](https://github.com/YaelDillies/LeanCamCombi/blob/master/LeanCamCombi/ExtrProbCombi/Containment.lean) here?

```suggestion
theorem free_congr (e : A ‚âÉg B) :
```

```suggestion
@[simp]
lemma free_bot : A.Free (‚ä• : SimpleGraph Œ≤) ‚Üî A \ne \top  := by
```
Sorry, can't unicode

If you meant `‚ä§`, I don't think that is possible.

```
example : ¬¨(‚ä• : SimpleGraph (Fin 2)).Free (‚ä• : SimpleGraph (Fin 2)) ‚àß (‚ä• : SimpleGraph (Fin 2)) ‚â† (‚ä§ : SimpleGraph (Fin 2)) := by
  and_intros
  ¬∑ rw [not_free]
    exact IsContained.rfl
  ¬∑ exact bot_ne_top
```

If you meant `‚ä•`, I don't think that is possible.
```
example : (‚ä• : SimpleGraph (Fin 2)).Free (‚ä• : SimpleGraph (Fin 1)) ‚àß ¬¨(‚ä• : SimpleGraph (Fin 2)) ‚â† (‚ä• : SimpleGraph (Fin 2)) := by
  and_intros
  ¬∑ by_contra! h
    absurd Nat.one_lt_two
    obtain ‚ü®f, hf‚ü© := h
    simpa using card_le_of_injective f hf
  ¬∑ tauto
```

I don't actually know how much you've taken from my file, but it does look furiously similar, so I'd be tempted to use the copyright header from there
```suggestion
Copyright (c) 2023 Ya√´l Dillies, Mitchell Horner. All rights reserved.
Released under Apache 2.0 license as described in the file LICENSE.
Authors: Ya√´l Dillies, Mitchell Horner
```

I took `Subgraph.isoMap` for the proof of `isContained_iff_exists_iso_subgraph` when you sent me the code on the original PR. The proof is shorter using that definition. (Thanks. üòÅ)

These results are pretty self-evident tbh and there aren't many ways to formalize them. I'd wager anyone formalizing this 1 definition would likely end up with a similar looking 40 lines of code as well (especially if you renamed everything üòÖ).

```suggestion
  `A`. This is the negation of `SimpleGraph.IsContained` implemented for convenience.

## Notation

The following notation is declared in locale `SimpleGraph`:
* `G ‚äë H` for `SimpleGraph.IsContained G H`.
```

```suggestion
```

```suggestion
@[refl] protected theorem IsContained.refl (G : SimpleGraph V) : G ‚äë G := ‚ü®.id G‚ü©

protected theorem IsContained.rfl : G ‚äë G := ‚ü®.id G‚ü©
```

No point having both IMO
```suggestion
theorem IsContained.trans : A ‚äë B ‚Üí B ‚äë C ‚Üí A ‚äë C := fun ‚ü®f‚ü© ‚ü®g‚ü© ‚Ü¶ ‚ü®g.comp f‚ü©
```

```suggestion
theorem IsContained.trans' : B ‚äë C ‚Üí A ‚äë B ‚Üí A ‚äë C := flip IsContained.trans
```

```suggestion
lemma IsContained.of_isEmpty [IsEmpty Œ±] : A ‚äë B :=
```

```suggestion
lemma bot_isContained (f : Œ± ‚Ü™ Œ≤) : (‚ä• : SimpleGraph Œ±) ‚äë B := ‚ü®‚ü®f, False.elim‚ü©, f.injective‚ü©

protected alias IsContained.bot := bot_isContained
```
I don't really understand this name

That's worrying because that def is one of the few things I took from the code you sent me.  üòÖ

https://github.com/YaelDillies/LeanCamCombi/blob/master/LeanCamCombi/Mathlib/Combinatorics/SimpleGraph/Subgraph.lean

I'll rename to `Subgraph.Copy.map`. This name reminds me of 
```
Iso.map (f : V ‚âÉ W) (G : SimpleGraph V) : G ‚âÉg G.map f.toEmbedding
```
which is similar to what is going on here.

```suggestion
alias ‚ü®IsContained.exists_iso_subgraph, IsContained.of_exists_iso_subgraph‚ü© :=
  isContained_iff_exists_iso_subgraph
```

```suggestion

lemma not_free : ¬¨A.Free B ‚Üî A ‚äë B := not_not

```
This is the same as `bot_isContained` but less convenient/idiomatic. Can you remove?

I had this for golfing (`simp` can finish the goals). I'll replace it with something like
```
bot_isContained_of_card_le [Fintype Œ±] [Fintype Œ≤] (h : card Œ± ‚â§ card Œ≤) : (‚ä• : SimpleGraph Œ±) ‚äë B
```

```suggestion
theorem IsContained.of_le (h : G‚ÇÅ ‚â§ G‚ÇÇ) : G‚ÇÅ ‚äë G‚ÇÇ := ‚ü®.ofLE G‚ÇÅ G‚ÇÇ h‚ü©
```

pullRequest.title: feat(Combinatorics/SimpleGraph): define Copy
